entries.title: Diwali 2022: India celebrates the festival with a dazzling display of lights
entries.description: Millions of Indians are illuminating their surroundings with lamps and fireworks to celebrate the festival.

entries.title: Hollywood reflects on MeToo impact as new Weinstein trial begins
entries.description: How have the revelations behind Harvey Weinstein's court cases changed how Hollywood works?

entries.title: Royal Mail: 100 days left to use stamps without a barcode
entries.description: Royal Mail says everyday stamps that do not have a barcode will no be longer valid after 31 January.

entries.title: MOTD2 analysis: Alan Shearer on how Newcastle got the edge on Tottenham
entries.description: Former Newcastle captain and manager Alan Shearer explains how his old club's pressing and unity helped them beat Tottenham 2-1.

entries.title: Rory McIlroy: Northern Irishman returns to top of world rankings with CJ Cup win
entries.description: Rory McIlroy overtakes Scottie Scheffler at the top of golf's world rankings by retaining his CJ Cup title in South Carolina.

entries.title: Boris Johnson pulls out of leadership race: Statement in full
entries.description: Boris Johnson's full statement as he rules himself out of the race to replace Liz Truss as the next PM.

entries.title: Hurricane Roslyn batters Mexico's Pacific coast
entries.description: The hurricane has since been downgraded to a tropical cyclone and is expected to dissipate overnight.

entries.title: ‘Newcastle starting to upset the big boys’ - Alan Shearer on Magpies' top-four hopes & win at Spurs
entries.description: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer was not expecting his old side Newcastle to be in the Premier League top four after 12 games but says their results show they mean business.

entries.title: Tottenham manager Antonio Conte calls for ‘money’,’time’ and ‘patience’ – but did VAR let Spurs down?
entries.description: Tottenham boss Antonio Conte says Spurs need "time and patience and, also for sure, money," after suffering a third defeat in five Premier League games.

entries.title: United States GP: Max Verstappen equals win record with late Lewis Hamilton overtake
entries.description: Max Verstappen fought back to pass Lewis Hamilton to win a dramatic United States Grand Prix and equal the record for victories in a season.

entries.title: Boris Johnson pulls out of Conservative leadership race
entries.description: The former PM says he had the support of the MPs needed but "it would not be the right thing to do".

entries.title: River pollution: New phosphate rules hit thousands of planned new homes
entries.description: Scrapping some new builds in England and Wales due to poor water quality could cost economy £16bn.

entries.title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Whose sheer presence causes pandemonium?
entries.description: Whose sheer presence causes pandemonium? Who dug his team out of a hole? Find out in Garth Crooks' latest Team of the Week.

entries.title: Leeds United boss Jesse Marsch defiant but storm raging at Elland Road after another loss
entries.description: Jesse Marsch says his long-term future is at Leeds but Sunday's loss to Fulham laid bare the problems he faces.

entries.title: Tributes paid to boy, 12, killed in Clacton garage wall collapse
entries.description: Scott-Swaley Daniel Stevens, 12, was "well-loved" and "will be missed by so many", his family says.

entries.title: Tottenham Hotspur 1-2 Newcastle United: Miguel Almiron scores again as Magpies climb to fourth
entries.description: Newcastle United's impressive early season form continues to gather momentum with a superb win at Tottenham which lifts them up into fourth in the Premier League table.

entries.title: Salman Rushdie has lost sight in one eye, agent Andrew Wylie says
entries.description: Literary agent Andrew Wylie gives an update on the novelist's health two months after his stabbing.

entries.title: Lady Leshurr charged with assault over Leyton fight
entries.description: Two women were taken to hospital after reports of a fight in east London, the Met says.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Virat Kohli produces another masterclass on special night in Melbourne
entries.description: India superstar Virat Kohli caps a sporting occasion like no other in Melbourne with a masterclass that ranks among his greatest feats.

entries.title: Southampton 1-1 Arsenal: Stuart Armstrong denies visitors 10th league win of season
entries.description: Arsenal drop points for only the second time this season as Stuart Armstrong's second-half equaliser earns Southampton a hard-earned point.

entries.title: Leeds 2-3 Fulham: Cottagers beat Whites to increase pressure on Marsch
entries.description: Fulham come from behind to leave Leeds without a win in eight games and pile the pressure on their boss Jesse Marsch.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Amazing finale as India beat Pakistan
entries.description: Watch the extraordinary finish to India's thrilling four-wicket victory over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

entries.title: Stratford stabbing: Woman dies and another is injured
entries.description: Police say they are looking for a man "believed to be known to both women".

entries.title: Philippines: Student 'anti-cheating' exam hats go viral
entries.description: College students were asked to create headwear to help resist the urge to peek at others' papers.

entries.title: Liverpool 0-2 Arsenal: Lia Walti and Frida Maanum goals seal 12th league win in a row
entries.description: Arsenal equal a Women's Super League record of 12 successive wins with a fairly routine victory over Liverpool.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Virat Kohli takes India to incredible victory over Pakistan
entries.description: A Virat Kohli-inspired India beat rivals Pakistan in an extraordinary finish to a Men's T20 World Cup classic at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

entries.title: King Charles III's first set of 100th birthday cards delivered
entries.description: Hundreds of people receive the first congratulatory messages from the new monarch and Queen Consort.

entries.title: T20 Word Cup - India v Pakistan: Virat Kohli hits three fours in crucial over
entries.description: Virat Kohli hits three fours in the 18th over to swing momentum India's way in a thrilling T20 World Cup match against Pakistan at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

entries.title: Ukraine war: The cost of occupation in Kherson region
entries.description: As Ukraine retakes territory, villagers tell the BBC about their precarious survival under Russian rule.

entries.title: UK faces tougher austerity era - ex-Bank chief
entries.description: Former Bank of England governor Lord King says people could face "significantly higher taxes".

entries.title: Russian fighter plane crashes in Siberian city of Irkutsk
entries.description: The Sukhoi Su-30 military jet was on a test flight when it came down in Irkutsk, authorities say.

entries.title: Penny Mordaunt denies deal talks with Boris Johnson team
entries.description: The minister, who was the first to formally enter the race, has said she remains "in it to win it".

entries.title: Shetland's damaged subsea cable now repaired, says operator
entries.description: A break in the lines connecting Shetland to the mainland had cut internet and phone services.

entries.title: Xi Jinping's party is just getting started
entries.description: China did not want another Mao, but the party did little to stop the rise of a more powerful leader.

entries.title: Boris Johnson 'clearly' going to stand to be PM, supporter says
entries.description: It comes after Boris Johnson held talks with his rival Rishi Sunak, amid speculation they could strike a deal.

entries.title: China congress: Xi cements power by packing top team with loyalists
entries.description: The Chinese leader moves into a historic third term in power and makes

entries.title: Surgery: Women regret overseas cut-price weight loss ops
entries.description: Emma spent 15 weeks in hospital after developing complications from her surgery in Turkey.

entries.title: Great niece backs sculptor in row over feminist Elsie Inglis statue
entries.description: Descendant of suffragist Dr Elsie Inglis speaks about controversy over statue planned for Edinburgh.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Sri Lanka dominate in nine-wicket win over Ireland
entries.description: Sri Lanka cruise to a nine-wicket victory over Ireland in their Super 12s opener at the T20 World Cup in Hobart.

entries.title: England 75-0 South Africa: Red Roses thrash Boks en route to World Cup last eight
entries.description: England steamroller South Africa to top Pool C on their way to a World Cup quarter-final against Australia.

entries.title: UFC 280 talking points: Islam Makhachev emulates his mentor
entries.description: Islam Makhachev produces a memorable win to emulate his mentor, and TJ Dillashaw fights on through the pain barrier - plus the other key talking points from UFC 280, in Abu Dhabi.

entries.title: Ukraine doctor desperate to be reunited with family
entries.description: Ahmed has been waiting since May to hear if visa applications have been successful.

entries.title: Gamer meets best mates for first time at his wedding
entries.description: Ryan George met four friends while playing Fifa and invited them to the happiest day of his life.

entries.title: Red Bull: 'Dietrich Mateschitz did it for the love of the sport'
entries.description: The emotion was unmistakable in Max Verstappen's face and voice as he paid tribute to Red Bull co-owner Dietrich Mateschitz after qualifying at the United States Grand Prix.

entries.title: Politburo Standing Committee: Who are the men that rule China now?
entries.description: The Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party makes up the country's power centre.

entries.title: Iran protests: Huge rally in Berlin in support
entries.description: About 80,000 people march in Germany's capital, in the biggest rally held so far by the Iranian diaspora.

entries.title: How the first report from Belsen concentration camp shocked the world
entries.description: In April 1945, the BBC’s Richard Dimbleby was the first reporter to enter the liberated Belsen concentration camp.

entries.title: Anime: My Neighbour Totoro takes to the Barbican stage
entries.description: My Neighbour Totoro, the classic anime film, has been recreated by the Royal Shakespeare Company.
